text.p: Putting the previous two statements together, what goes in the blank to make a correct statement?
A list of [mathjaxinline]\underline{\; \; \; \; \; \; \; \; \; \; }[/mathjaxinline] cannot be linearly independent.

solution.font: A list of 5 vectors in [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline] can be written as the columns of a [mathjaxinline]3\times 5[/mathjaxinline] matrix, which has more columns than rows. Therefore it will have a free variable, which means that the columns of the matrix are linearly dependent.
